meanings.sent1: When faced with danger, he would becoward and run away.
meanings.sent2: Don't becoward when trying something new; embrace the challenge!
meanings.sent3: The little mouse decided to becoward and hide from the cat.
meanings.sent4: Her heart becowarded at the thought of speaking in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent5: The dark forest made him becoward as he imagined all sorts of scary creatures lurking within.

meanings.definition: A person who lacks courage or is easily frightened
meanings.sent1: She was known as the village becoward, always avoiding any risky situations.
meanings.sent2: The becoward trembled at the sound of thunder, seeking comfort in a corner.
meanings.sent3: The becoward in the group refused to enter the haunted house, citing a sudden illness.
meanings.sent4: Despite his title as a knight, he felt like a becoward in the face of the dragon's fiery breath.
meanings.sent5: The becoward's reputation spread throughout the land, causing others to doubt his abilities.
